byline.contributor: David D. Kirkpatrick reported from Cairo, and Saeed Al-Batati from Al Mukalla, Yemen.
byline.original: By DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK and SAEED AL-BATATI

abstract: Former Yemeni Pres Ali Abdullah Saleh calls for truce but adds that he is standing by demands for ouster of his Saudi Arabia-backed successor Pres Abdu Rabbu Mansour Hadi; Saleh is backing Houthi movement, which has seized country's largest cities, and his statement was made after Saudi-led campaign of airstrikes against Houthi forces.
lead_paragraph: In a 10-minute address broadcast on Yemeni television, Ali Abdullah Saleh called for elections to choose a new president.

headline.main: Ex-Yemeni Leader Urges Truce and Successor’s Ouster
headline.print_headline: Ex-Yemeni Leader Urges Truce and Successor’s Ouster

snippet: In a 10-minute address broadcast on Yemeni television, Ali Abdullah Saleh called for elections to choose a new president.
